000075090-d-04-19-10-CSX.Narrative: S33420 WAS PULLING DOWN DEPARTURE 12 TO GO INTO RECEIVING 7. THE CONDUCTOR LINED R07 SWITCH FOR MOVEMENT INTO THE RECEIVING TRACKS. AFTER THE SWITCHES WERE LINED FOR THE MOVEMENT S33420 PROCEEDED AHEAD 29 CARS INTO R07 TRACK WHEN THE L1 WHEEL ON THE 31ST CAR WENT BEHIND THE R08 SWITCH CAUSING FOUR CARS TO DERAIL. AFTER WALKING THE TRACKS CREW FOUND A BLEED ROD WEDGED IN BETWEEN THE STOCK RAIL ANDTHE SWITCH POINT OF THE R08 SWITCH. IT IS BELIEVED THAT THE BLEED ROD HAD BEEN BROKEN OFF DURING NORMAL HUMPING OPERATIONS AS THE CARS WHERE TRAVERSING THE R08 SWITCH IN A TRAILING MOVEMENT THUS CATCHING THE OBJECT AND WEDGING IT IN BETWEEN POINTS. THIS CAUSED THE SWITCH POINT TO GAP ENOUGH FOR THEL1 WHEEL ON THE OOCX 2431 TO GO BEHIND IT DERAILING THE CAR IN FRONT AND TWO OTHERS TRAILING. CAR WITH MISSING BLEED ROD IS CNIS 417176.

280216-d-04-25-10-TCT.Primary Accident Cause: Failure to apply hand brakes on car(s) (railroad employee)
280216-d-04-25-10-TCT.Accident Cause: Failure to apply hand brakes on car(s) (railroad employee)
280216-d-04-25-10-TCT.Narrative:
AT ABOUT 9AM SUNDAY APRIL 25, 2010 THE 7AM XTRA JOB USING LOCO NO. 36 WAS SWITCHING OUT A CUT OF CARS ON THE EAST END OF THE 600 YARD. THE TRAIN SHOING 34 CARS PLUS LOCO, MOVING EAST INTO YARD TRACK 602 CUT OFF TWO CARS CLEAR OF THE LEAD, FOREMAN DID NOT SET HAND BRAKES ON THESE TWO CARS. THE TRAINWITH 32 CARS PLUS LOCO, MOVED WEST TO CLEAR THE SWITCH POINT, FOREMAN LINED TURNOUT FOR TRACK 599 AND GAVE SIGNAL TO MOVE EAST INTO TRACK 599 TO SET OUT 5 CARS. ONCE THE 5 CARS TO BE CUT OFF WERE CLEAR THE LEAD, MOVEMENT WAS STOPPED, FOREMAN PULLED PIN AND GAVE INSTRUCTION TO ENGINEER TO GO EAST WITH THE 27 REMAINING CARS 
PLUS LOCO. WITHIN MOMENTS THE FOREMAN HEARD METAL SCRAPING AND REALIZED THE TWO ARS PREVIOUSLY CUT OFF IN RACK 602 HAD
 ROLLED BACK TO FOUL THE MOVING TRAIN AND WERE IN CONTACT WITH THE CARS ON THE LEAD MOVING EAST, HE INSTRUCTED ENGINEER TO 
STIP AND MOVEMENT WAS STOPPEDWITHIN 150 FT OF CONTACT POINT. THE EAST CAR ON TWO CUT OFFIN 602 "CORNERED" CAR NUMBER 26 OF 
THE28 CAR TRAIN, BEOMING ENTANGLED AT THE BOLSTERS, DRAGGING THE TRAILING CAR OUT OF 602 INTO THE SIDEOF CAR NUMBER 27 AND 28 OF THE MOVING CONSIST. ONE CAR HAD MINOR DAMAGE TO RUNNING BOARD. FOUR CARSHAD MODERATE TO SEVER DAMAGE TO BOLSTERS, AIR BRAKE VALVE ASSEMBLY, RUNNING BOARDS, HAND RAILS, SAFETY RAILS, SIDE LADDERS, TANK JACKETS, ETC. ONE CAR,HAD ONE TRUCK DERAILED. THERE WAS NOT RELEASE OFPRODUCT FROM ANY OF THE CARS INVOLVED.

000074594-d-04-01-10-CSX.Narrative: N26827 WAS TOLD TO SET THEIR REAR ENGINE CSXT 7757 INTO THE L2 TRACK. ENGINEER SHOVED HIS ENGINES INTO L2 TRACK AND BEGAN TO SECURE CSXT 7757 AND PERFORM A BRAKE TEST. ENGINEER SECURED THE HANDBRAKE AND PERFORMED A 103I BRAKE TEST. THE DOWNLOAD FROM THE LEAD ENGINE SHOWED THAT THE TEST WAS PERFORMEDCORRECTLY AND DVR VIDEO FROM THE SECOND ENGINE SHOWED THE ENGINEER WORKING THROUGH THE PROCESS TO SECURE CSXT 7757 AND BREAKING AWAY FROM THE CSXT 7757. THE DVR SHOWED CSXT 7757 STANDING STILL ON A 2% GRADE AND BEING HELD BY ITS HANDBRAKE. AT 0955 RECEIVED A PHONE CALL FROM TSI SUBCONTRACTOR WORKING WITHIN THE STILESBORO POWER PLANT THAT AN ENGINE HAD ROLLED OUT OF L2 TRACK AND DERAILED. IT WAS FOUND THE ENGINE HANDBRAKE HAD BEEN RELEASED. IT IS ESTIMATED THAT THE LOCOMOTIVE ROLLED OUT AT A SPEED EXCEEDING THE AUTHORIZED SPEED FOR THAT TRACK.

000074784-d-04-08-10-CSX.Narrative: WHILE MOVING THROUGH P-03 TRACK TO THE EAST LEAD, THE Q14106 TRAIN WAS SIDESWIPED BY AN OVERHEAD CRANE (MIJACK) UNLOADING CARS ON THE NORTH END OF P-04 TRACK, WHEN THE OPERATOR PULLED BACK TOO FAR FOULING THE P-03 TRACK THE Q141 WAS OPERATING ON.  THE CRANE DAMAGED THE 5TH, 6TH, AND 7TH CAR IN THE TRAIN CONSIST.     THE INVESTIGATION REVEALED THAT THE CRANE OPERATOR FAILED TO COMPLY WITH CSXI RULES G-13 AND G-28. HE DID NOT USE CAMERA SYSTEM TO ENSURE THE WAY WAS CLEAR FOR HIS MOVEMENT AND WAS NOT SUFFICIENTLY ENGAGED WITH THE MOVEMENT OF THE TRAIN IN HIS AREA OF OPERATION. Q141 WAS GIVEN PERMISSION BY CSXI TO MAKE THE MOVEMENT AND COMPLIED WITH ALL OPERATING RULES. CSXI ACKNOWLEDGED IT WASTHEIR RESPONSIBILITY TO ENSURE THEIR EQUIPMENT DID NOT FOUL THE MOVEMENT OF THE TRAIN.

667721-d-04-17-10-IC.Narrative: L55192-17 WAS SWITCHING AT THE NORTH END OF CHAMPAIGN A-YARD. THE CREW TIED ON TO TRACK CA14, STRETCHED IT, AND KICKED IT IN TO HOLD 7 CARS. THEY THEN KICKED ONE CAR TO TRACK CA9 AND TWO CARS TO TRACKCA11. THE CONDUCTOR THEN LET A LOADED TANK CAR, UTLX 664274, ROLL TOWARDS THE RIP TRACK. THE BRAKEMAN, WHO WAS STANDING AT THE 13 SWITCH, MOUNTED THE TANK CAR TO OPERATE THE HAND BRAKE. WHILE RIDINGTHE CAR TOWARDS THE 14 SWITCH, HE NOTICED THAT 14 TRACK WAS ROLLING TOWARDS THE LEAD. THE BRAKEMAN DISMOUNTED THE CAR AND THE TANK CAR IMPACTED THE GTW 127060, A LOADED BOXCAR THAT ROLLED OUT CAR CA14TRACK.THE L3 AND L4 WHEELS WERE DERAILED ON THE GTW 127060. THERE WERE NO INJURIES REPORTED. THE CAUSE OF THIS DERAILMENT WAS DETERMINED TO BE THAT A SUFFICIENT NUMBER OF HANDBRAKES WERE NOT APPLIEDTO TRACK 14
